sense.name: finding or insight
sense.commentary: DISCOVERY[+event] find, uncovering, breakthrough - the act of discovering something
sense.examples: Their discovery of the treasure in the backyard made them rich. Since her discovery of the stray cat she's been a happier child.

sense.name: thing found
sense.examples: Fido's new discovery suddenly jumped up and hopped across the yard. John's picked up his discovery and place it into his pocket.

sense.name: disclosure of facts
sense.commentary: (law) compulsory pretrial disclosure of documents relevant to the case; enables one side in a litigation to elicit information from the other side concerning the facts in the case
sense.examples: They used electronic discovery and evidence resources. Evidence and data discovery was done the night before the trial.
